entries.meaning: (typography, plural only) Letters in an italic typeface.
examples: There is no need to put the whole paragraph in italics.

entries.meaning: (usually plural but sometimes singular in construction) plural of italic: exaggerated intonation or some similar oral speech device by which one or more words is heavily and usually affectedly emphasized or otherwise given sharp prominence
examples: […]  was yapping, her silly voice fraught with italics.
